post.author: BNA!
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
Merry Christmas. I'm assuming with BNA having a kid it's going to just get more & more fun as you think of neat stuff to get them.


Absolutely - thanks for taking note!

I said it randomly here and there on the forums - Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!

Usually I'd be writing my wishes and outlook to technology and gaming, but nothing has changed in the last few years, so it's very obsolete to simply restate old opinions which still lay too far ahead into the future.

But there's one thing I'm pretty sure that will be part of the worldspawn soon: a GPS coordinate

post.body: Merry Christmas!

post.body: Merry stuff and eating y'all.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
Funny story.

The wife and I got the kids their presents over a week ago. I e-mailed my dad a list of what we got them. He mistakenly thought it was a list of what they wanted... so my son got TWO kindles (one from us and them), and my other son got TWO Optimus Prime knex sets.

Hilarious!

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Hehe, that's like something out of a movie! Classic Christmas moment though!

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
Merry Christmas. I'm assuming with BNA having a kid it's going to just get more & more fun as you think of neat stuff to get them.


Absolutely - thanks for taking note!

I said it randomly here and there on the forums - Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!

Usually I'd be writing my wishes and outlook to technology and gaming, but nothing has changed in the last few years, so it's very obsolete to simply restate old opinions which still lay too far ahead into the future.

But there's one thing I'm pretty sure that will be part of the worldspawn soon: a GPS coordinate

post.author: tea monster
post.body: Merry Christmas!

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body: Merry stuff and eating y'all.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
Funny story.

The wife and I got the kids their presents over a week ago. I e-mailed my dad a list of what we got them. He mistakenly thought it was a list of what they wanted... so my son got TWO kindles (one from us and them), and my other son got TWO Optimus Prime knex sets.

Hilarious!

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Hehe, that's like something out of a movie! Classic Christmas moment though!
